description: Arrange the production ML pipeline steps in the correct order.
instructions: Think about the MLOps lifecycle: What must exist before training? What must be registered before serving? Pattern: features → training → registration → deployment → A/B testing → monitoring.

blocks.code: Create Feature Store table with online serving enabled
blocks.label: Set Up Feature Store

blocks.code: Train model using Feature Store features, log to MLflow
blocks.label: Train with Feature Lookup

blocks.code: Register best model in Unity Catalog Model Registry
blocks.label: Register Model

blocks.code: Create serverless serving endpoint with Champion model
blocks.label: Deploy Serving Endpoint

blocks.code: Add Challenger model with 10% traffic routing
blocks.label: Set Up A/B Test

blocks.code: Configure drift monitoring, threshold alerts, auto-retrain trigger
blocks.label: Enable Monitoring

hints: Features must be defined before training can use them
Training uses Feature Store lookups for consistent features
Models must be registered before serving
The Champion endpoint must exist before adding a Challenger
A/B testing routes a percentage of traffic to the new model
Monitoring is the final safety net for production models
learnings: Model training uses features from the store
Model Registry versions and stages models
Model Serving deploys for real-time inference
Monitoring detects drift and triggers retraining
